intro: Chaetaria forskalii, commonly known as the Arctic haircap moss, is a small, perennial moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in moist, rocky habitats in arctic and alpine regions. The plant has leafy shoots that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures, giving it its common name. It thrives in cold climates and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Chaetaria forskalii plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitat for other arctic flora.
